item.title: Can someone help me make NPCS drop stuff after death?
item.dc:creator: @delta delta
item.description:
@delta wrote:

Lol I don’t know how to make it random, but this is a way to make it so monsters drop 10k every time

if(npcs[NPCID].npcType == ###) {
ItemHandler.addItem(995, npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 10000, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false);
}

item.title: Can someone help me make NPCS drop stuff after death?
item.dc:creator: @delta delta
item.description:
@delta wrote:

OK in npchandler search

public void MonsterDropItem(int NPCID) { { if (IsDropping == false) { IsDropping = true; int Play = GetNpcKiller(NPCID); int Maxi = server.itemHandler.DropItemCount; for (int i = 0; i <= Maxi; i++) { if (server.itemHandler.DroppedItemsID[i] > 0) { } else {

Add this

if(npcs[NPCID].npcType == ####) { ItemHandler.addItem(Item2.randomwhateveryoucallit(), npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 1, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false); }
Replace #### with the npc id.
Now open item2.java and put this in

[code]
public static int whateveryoucallit[] = {1305, 4587};

    public static int randomwhateveryoucallit()
    {
        return whateveryoucallit[(int)(Math.random()*whateveryoucallit.length)];
    }[/code]

Replace “whateveryoucallit” with any name
The numbers are the random Ids what the npc could drop
That is how you make npc drops…

Read full topic
